channel.title: Error lol
channel.description:
Anyone know how to fix?
I get after about 20-30 minutes
[code] java.net.SocketException: Connection reset at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:168) at client.fillInStream(client.java:8301) at client.run(client.java:16551) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (c-98-217-29-24.hsd1.ct.comcast.net) Exception encountered while parsing incoming packets from Dharock pure. java.lang.NullPointerException at misc.playerNameToInt64(misc.java:171) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:13783) at client.packetProcess(client.java:16106) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:271) at process.run(process.java:23) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)[/code]

item.title: Error lol
item.dc:creator: @Shogunreaper Shogunreaper
item.description:
@Shogunreaper wrote:

So is there no way to fix? This is in my files ( I did not make obviously lol)

[CODE]
// FrontEnd Plus GUI for JAD
// DeCompiled : Null.class

import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.ServerSocket;

public class Null
{

public Null()
{
}

public void resetserver()
{
    misc.println("shutting down server");
    PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
    misc.println("saved all player");
    closeListener();
    runserver();
}

public void runserver()
{
    try
    {
        String run = "runserver.bat";
        String xstr = (new StringBuilder()).append("./").append(run).toString();
        Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
    }
    catch(IOException ioe)
    {
        ioe.printStackTrace();
    }
}

public void closeListener()
{
    try
    {
        server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
        if(server.clientListener != null)
            server.clientListener.close();
        server.clientListener = null;
    }
    catch(Exception __ex)
    {
        __ex.printStackTrace();
    }
}

}[/CODE]

Read full topic

item.title: Error lol
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Itâ€™s being caused because people are logging out, and wL servers do not correctly clean up after the connection, the never even in fact close the Socket. So the server is still thinking there is a connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Error lol
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

yay for wL. But basically what rog3r says is correct. People are logging out which is nulling your server. I suggest learning a bit of java and use rs2dv.
